channel.title: Need help from you pc builders
channel.description:
My original issue was my monitor would randomly shut off. Tried 2 monitors, tried 2 cables, tried 2 graphics cards, still happened. It didn't happen in safemode so I assumed it was a driver issue. Tried everything to completely remove my display drivers, ended up re-installing windows since I was over due for a clean wipe anyway. Didn't work. Long story short odds are its the mobo
My computer is: http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAG...
That I moved into an Antec 902 case and swapped the power supply with a Corsair GS700 and the graphics card with a GTX 560 TI
I need a new motherboard but I'm lost.. How do I know what will be compatible with my wireless card and stuff? Will my cpu fan fit or does the new mobo come with one? Will my cpu chip fit? If my sound card is integrated do I need to buy another one? Obviously to get the motherboard in the new case I had to "install it" but what I really mean is how do I setup everything on it?
All of the parts of the computer are well documented by HP in the link above, itd be great if someone could walk me through this lol. I'm familiar with pc's but I haven't actually built one from scratch before
And also, how much would all this cost?! I was hoping under $100 but if not I guess ill have to wait even longer before I get a new graphics card

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Frell:

Everything went pretty much flawlessly, booted up fine and didn’t need to reinstall windows. Should I anyway? Or can I just install the new mobo drivers from the disc and be good?

You don’t need to reinstall windows, for the most part Windows will find drivers that work decent enough with the hardware. The only time you should install the manufacturer ones is if you experience problems or need a feature that isn’t provided

Read full topic
item.source: Need help from you pc builders

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Got my 770 and my motherboard did not like it. Didn’t even boot, it must have required a bios update and HP stopped rolling those out for my computer back in 2011

Just ordered the ASRock Z75, hopefully everything goes smooth :s

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Frell:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813157304

damaging the cpu isn’t likely unless you just throw the cpu on the ground after you take it out or just throw it in the slot when re-installing it. when i upgraded mine, i just set it on top of a piece of toilet paper

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

im going to order a new mobo tomorrow

If I get it and its faulty or I accidentally break my cpu (which im paranoid about) I’m done with pc gaming. It really isn’t worth all this bullshit lol, will just return 770 and get a ps4.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help from you pc builders

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:50, topic:535255”]And guess what just happened again today after replacing the psu fixed it for an entire month…

guess the only thing left to replace is the motherboard…[/quote]

try an external gpu first, it went bad on my old desktop ~10 years old and I bought a graphics card changed settings in bios and fixed the problem.

If you’re going to replace the mobo anyway, here’s what I use: http://www.amazon.com/Gigabyte-DDR3-Micro-Motherboard-GA-78LMT-S2/dp/B00981571O/ref=sr_1_3?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1386520979&sr=1-3

Read full topic

it could be servel things like the power saving settings for the montior or the power cord for the montior has a short or ur pci slot is bad i dont think it could be too many other things

item.source: Need help from you pc builders

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Since I have to take my psu out to get to the motherboard anyway I decided to try my old PSU to see if I could get it to crash.

When my monitor goes off I can still hear youtube videos and skype, so theres a slim chance it isn’t the motherboard. Maybe the PSU’s power is dipping and the computer shuts off display. But safemode probably doesn’t draw in enough power for it to happen

Ill see what happens, cant order mobo till monday anyway

Read full topic
item.source: Need help from you pc builders

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:41, topic:535255”][quote author=Rash link=topic=654057.msg4382077#msg4382077 date=1383900231]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654057.msg4382029#msg4382029 date=1383872436]

[quote author=Rash link=topic=654057.msg4382026#msg4382026 date=1383871971]

Most motherboards come with in built wifi these days,
[/quote]what? no they don’t…they normally come with lan

No, they most come with WIFI.I just build like 6 computers all with different boards, they all have it.
[/quote]I didn’t say they didn’t come with wifi. I said it isn’t as common as you make it sound. A good many of them only have lan, some don’t even have that.

Almost all new boards have it in built?
[/quote]ah that explains it “new motherboards” xD… I used to work with the government as an IT technician so we were still in the celeron/mobos for the horrible cpu’s lol[/quote]

ok alison

Read full topic

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I found a standard ATX board for just about the same price that actually has a x1 PCI slot instead of guessing if the other will work:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813157304

So if I get that I can either get a card or a usb receiver

Read full topic
item.source: Need help from you pc builders

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Frell:

yea but I was told you’ll get BSODs if you don’t reinstall after a mobo upgrade

You only need to re install after changing the HDD, changing the mobo shouldn’t give you bsod, only reason that would happen is because of driver issues.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help from you pc builders

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Yeah that one doesn’t look bad. I’d still get the Linksys one though, but that’s just me.

Again, Frell, if the USB devices uses the same wifi standards (IEEE 802.11b/g/n) as your router (802.11n), then it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Yes some motherboards don’t have on-board LAN, but those ones are probably outdated. Almost all modern motherboards include it. Truth is, it costs more for companies to sell an extra PCIe card for the LAN than it does to just integrate it into the mobo.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help from you pc builders
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:34, topic:535255”]Ok I guess ill go ahead and get that, itll work for non-linksys routers right? We use an apple airport[/quote]As long as your router supports IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n (which are the wi-fi standards) it will work. Your router does so you’re good to go.

Read full topic
